title: Pro Bankruptcy Briefing: Superior Energy Files for Bankruptcy; J.C. Penney Completes Sale, Lines Up Loans From Wells Fargo; SBA Opposes PPP Recipient’s Plan
body:
Good day. Superior Energy became the latest oil and gas drilling services company to file for chapter 11, while J.C. Penney said it is exiting bankruptcy and has closed a deal to sell its operations to mall owners. The  Small Business Administraion took issue with Astria Health’s restructuring plan.
Top News
Superior Energy Services Files for Bankruptcy
Superior Energy Services Inc. filed for chapter 11 Monday with a plan to eliminate almost all of its debt. The Houston-based company, which rents and sells equipment used in oil and gas drilling, filed for reorganization in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Houston with a fast-track plan to cut debt and hand over ownership to its bondholders. Read more.
